content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained" )

content.text: 0) Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "Preheat"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-0-0 "oven"@11:15 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-0-0 "400 degrees F"@19:32 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-0-1 "200 degrees C"@34:47 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 1) In a medium-sized mixing bowl, stir together mayonnaise, sour cream, Parmesan cheese and onion.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "stir"@34:38 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "mayonnaise"@48:58 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "sour cream"@60:70 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "Parmesan cheese"@72:87 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "onion"@92:97 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-1-0 "a medium-sized mixing bowl"@6:32 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 2) When these ingredients are combined, mix in artichoke hearts, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "mix in"@40:46 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-3 "artichoke hearts"@47:63 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "lemon juice"@65:76 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-6 "salt and pepper"@78:93 / FOOD )
		:duration ( cond-2-0 "When these ingredients are combined"@3:38 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Transfer mixture to a shallow baking dish.
4) Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 20 minutes, or until light brown on top.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
	:inform ( ac-4-0 "Bake"@3:7 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-4-0 "400 degrees F"@11:24 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-4-1 "200 degrees C"@26:39 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-4-0 "20 minutes"@45:55 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-4-0 "until light brown on top"@60:84 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)
